FILE NAME:      KDEGDAY

                Weather time series based on population shifts and degree-day data or assumptions
                Historical weather through October 2022; November 2022-December 2023 uses NOAA forecast;
                 2024-2050 uses 30-year (1992-2021) linear trend by state

DATE MODIFIED:  November 9, 2022

USED BY:        Consumption subroutine of the National Energy Modeling System (NEMS)
                 Commercial Sector Demand Module (CDM) and
                 Residential Sector Demand Module (RDM)

DEFINITION:     Heating and Cooling Degree Days

UNITS:          Degrees Fahrenheit * Days

DIMENSION:      by year, census division

SPECIAL CONSTRAINTS:  Non-negative values

ORGANIZATION OF DATA:

                The first column in each row provides the corresponding year.

                There are 2 rows of data corresponding to each year, with the first row of each pair
                 providing the heating degree days and the second row the cooling degree days.

                The remaining columns of data correspond to the 9 U.S. census divisions in the following order:
                 New England, Middle Atlantic, East North Central, West North Central, South Atlantic,
                 East South Central, West South Central, Mountain, and Pacific.

                The data for years beyond those with historical data represent the trend in heating and cooling degree days,
                 adjusted to account for projected shifts in population within and between census divisions.

                Data starts on row 101 of this file as per CDM convention.    

SOURCES:        Developed using NOAA population-weighted weather data, as well as census population data and population
                 projections developed by IHS Markit

                Monthly heating and cooling degree days from NOAA’s National Centers for Environmental Information (formerly National Climate Data Center); excludes AK, DC, and HI:
                  ftp://ftp.ncei.noaa.gov/pub/data/cirs/climdiv/

                Monthly heating and cooling degree days for AK, DC, and HI from NOAA’s Climate Prediction Center:
                  ftp://ftp.cpc.ncep.noaa.gov/htdocs/products/analysis_monitoring/cdus/degree_days/archives/

                15-month heating and cooling degree forecast from NOAA’s Climate Prediction Center:
                  http://www.cpc.ncep.noaa.gov/pacdir/DDdir/ddforecast.txt


















































        Census Division
        1       2       3       4       5       6       7       8       9
